Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Meucin-49 (natural AMPs; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 70% similarity toScorpion BmKbpp.Activity: Active against Gram+ bacteria S. aureus, 3-7 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 1.33 uM), B. cereus (MIC 6.3 uM), B. megaterium CGMCC 1.0459 (MIC 0.37 uM), B. subtilis CGMCC 1.2428 (MIC 0.33 uM), M. luteus CGMCC 1.0290 (MIC 0.33 uM), S. sanguinis (MIC 2.76 uM), S. salivarius MIC 3.8 uM), S. mutans CGMCC 1.2499 (MIC 2.5 uM), S. warneri CGMCC 1.2824 (MIC 4.3 uM), S. griseus NBRC 13350 (MIC 8.3 uM), S. CGMCC 4.1765 (MIC 3 uM), Gram-negative bacteria E. coli (MIC 2.6-5.3 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 4-7 uM), P. solanacearum (MIC 8 uM), S. enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC 3.8 uM), S. marcescens ATCC 14041 (MIC 17 uM), S. maltophilia CGMCC 1.1788 (MIC 7.1 uM).Structure:  synthetic peptide meucin-49(1-31) is helical in the presence of 50% TFE.Synergy:others: The low abundance of this peptide led to the proposal and testing synergistic effects with neurotoxins. 05/2018; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Gao B, Dalziel J, Tanzi S, Zhu S.2018
Literature Information.Title: Meucin-49, a multifunctional scorpion venom peptide with bactericidal synergy with neurotoxins
